SORRY, I HAD TO.

Check  this out https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source
may it helps

You could select whatever open source project you would like to contribute to
they should have a file named CONTRIBUTE.md which contains their contribution guidelines
Then you could select any open issues they have and create a new branch for fixing this issue
then after you fix it you open a pull request explaining what you did
and keep on praying that they merge your pull request :)
Find a typo in docs, fix the typo

Maybe follow and set notifications for this twitter account
https://twitter.com/yourfirstpr
Scott hanselman published a website to help people contribute to their first open source project. Check it out.

Github is just a code reporistery , uploading your code there doesn't mean contribution.  

contribution is a value you are adding in some field even you are writing code from scratch or contribute in exist open source project . 

so firstly choose an idea and start to  implement it in your favourite technology that you have experience in.  

this about contribution.  about using git commit ,push , pull and dealing with git you can start by reading simple tutroials about git by simple google search query "git tutorials "
